abstract: With the likely benefit of G.D.P. growth on their side, future generations should find it easier to care for the elderly even as the population ages, an economist writes.
snippet: With the likely benefit of G.D.P. growth on their side, future generations should find it easier to care for the elderly even as the population ages, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economist at Princeton. For previous posts in his series on why America pays so much for health care, click here, here, here and here.

headline.main: U.S. Health Care Costs, Part V: Can Americans Afford Medicare?
